span: Not a Good Buy for Me – Disappointed with Quality and Condition
review-date: Reviewed in the United States on November 1, 2025
review-text: I bought a Samsung Galaxy S24 Ultra (Unlocked, Refurbished Excellent, 256GB, 12GB RAM, Violet) through Amazon Renewed, and unfortunately, my experience has been very disappointing. The phone’s model number is SM-S928U, which means it was originally carrier-locked, not a true factory-unlocked model (those are SM-S928U1). Because of this—or possibly another issue—the phone is stuck on Android 14 with One UI 6 and shows “up to date,” so it can’t be updated to the latest Android 15 / One UI 8. Cosmetically, it’s also not “Excellent” as described. There are noticeable scratches on the back, and the screen has faint white lines or faded marks beneath the surface that can’t be wiped away. It looks more like “Good” condition at best. Overall, this product does not meet the quality standards I expected from Amazon Renewed. It’s disappointing that something listed as “Excellent” arrived with both software and cosmetic issues. I’ll be returning it for a refund. Buyers, please double-check listings and model numbers before purchasing — quality control seems to have slipped lately.

review-date: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2026
review-text: It makes a beeping sound when you charged. Need a message Take a picture record. video it's a constant beep.No matter what it does, you can just sit there and start beeping

review-date: Reviewed in the United States on January 22, 2026
review-text: Teléfono con falla no lo recomiendo pedi un cambio al vendedor y no lo iso

review-date: Reviewed in the United States on December 22, 2025
review-text: Dice desbloqueado de fábrica pero no me permite usar una red especifica y aparece el mensaje de bloqueado

review-date: Reviewed in the United States on October 16, 2025
review-text: The phone I received was managed by T mobile and it was a work phone managed by employer. I could not remove the app as it was monitoring all my calls, contact and wifi. I contacted Amazon support and they suggested to return the phone as it cannot be fixed. I returned the phone on same day.

review-date: Reviewed in the United States on November 6, 2025
review-text: I had to return it, the screen had a "transparent" precaution sign that didn't go away, additionally the screen had a very poor definition even worst than my S22. Very disappointed.
a-color-secondary: Reviewed in the United States on November 6, 2025
a-size-base: I had to return it, the screen had a "transparent" precaution sign that didn't go away, additionally the screen had a very poor definition even worst than my S22. Very disappointed.

span: Some phone functions are partially unavailable.
review-date: Reviewed in the United States on November 21, 2025
review-text: Some things look good, but some don't function properly. They don't have a factory reset function, and data transfer from older phones doesn't work.

review-date: Reviewed in the United States on December 3, 2025
review-text: As others mentioned, there is no guarantee this phone is unlocked, mine came AT&T locked so returning it

review-date: Reviewed in the United States on October 20, 2025
review-text: This phone is not factory unlocked. It is locked to network which would prevent you from using any mobile service. The seller is not taking responsibility for the false information  they have on Amazon.

review-date: Reviewed in the United States on August 28, 2025
review-text: Received carrier-locked SM-S928U, not SM-S928U1 factory unlocked. Can't call it "Factory Unlocked" for my future resale/trade. Year listed is not 2019 – 24’s were made in 2024. Memory listed as 512 GB. Main listing correct: 256. They told me: "try permanent unlock" via settings. Unlock process is initiated by the carrier itself, not through the phone's settings, or by me. LOTS of time wasted.
